question_text: Is the establishment maintaining equal rates of wages for employees of all genders performing the same or similar nature of work?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: There shall be no discrimination in an establishment or any unit thereof among employees on the ground of gender in matters relating to wages by the same employer, in respect of the same work or work of a similar nature done by any employee.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Register of Wages or Payroll Sheet for the most recent month.
Step 2: Identification: Select at least two employees of different genders holding the same designation/job role.
Step 3: Verification: Compare the 'Rate of Wages' column for these employees to ensure no disparity exists based on gender.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a clear image/PDF of the wage register showing employee names, designations, gender, and basic wage rates.
capture_instructions.title: Equal Remuneration Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the uploaded document is a Payroll or Wage Register containing columns for Employee Name, Designation, and Wage Rate. Reject if unreadable.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Analyze the data to identify employees with the same 'Designation'. For such pairs, compare the 'Basic Wage' or 'Rate of Wages'. Flag 'Non-Compliant' if significant disparity exists between different genders for the same role without apparent tenure/seniority difference.

question_text: Are all employees being paid wages not less than the minimum rate notified by the appropriate Government for their specific category?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: No employer shall pay to any employee wages less than the minimum rate of wages notified by the appropriate Government.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify the establishment's zone/category and the current applicable Minimum Wage Notification.
Step 2: Request the Register of Wages.
Step 3: Check the 'Gross Wages' or 'Basic + DA' column for unskilled, semi-skilled, and skilled workers.
Step 4: Ensure the amount is equal to or higher than the notified rate.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the wage register page highlighting the lowest-paid employee category (e.g., Unskilled/Helper).
capture_instructions.title: Minimum Wage Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify the document is a Wage Register with numeric wage columns. Ensure it is legible.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract the lowest value in the 'Basic + DA' or 'Gross Wage' column. Compare this against the provided context of [Current Minimum Wage Rate]. If the extracted value is lower than the threshold, mark as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Is overtime being paid at a rate not less than twice the normal rate of wages for work done in excess of normal working hours?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments where employees work beyond normal hours (usually >8 hours/day or >48 hours/week).
legal_text: Where an employee... works on any day in excess of the number of hours constituting a normal working day, the employer shall pay him for every hour... at the overtime rate which shall not be less than twice the normal rate of wages.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Register of Overtime' or the Wage Register containing an 'Overtime' column.
Step 2: Identify an employee who performed overtime.
Step 3: Calculate the hourly rate: (Monthly Normal Wage / 26 / 8).
Step 4: Verify that the OT payment = (OT Hours * 2 * Hourly Rate).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a document showing OT hours worked and the corresponding OT amount paid.
capture_instructions.title: Overtime Rate Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document contains columns for 'OT Hours' and 'OT Amount' or 'Overtime Wages'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Normal Wage Rate', 'OT Hours', and 'OT Paid Amount'. Calculate: (Normal Rate * 2 * OT Hours). If 'OT Paid Amount' is less than this calculated value (allowing for minor rounding), flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Has the establishment defined the normal working day (hours) and is it compliant with the statutory limit (typically 8-9 hours)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: The appropriate Government may fix the number of hours of work which shall constitute a normal working day inclusive of one or more specified intervals.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Locate the 'Notice of Working Hours' displayed on the notice board.
Step 2: Check the 'Start Time', 'End Time', and 'Rest Intervals'.
Step 3: Verify the total working hours do not exceed 9 hours (or as per State rules) and spread-over is within limits (usually 10.5 - 12 hours).

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the Notice Board displaying daily working hours and rest intervals.
capture_instructions.title: Working Hours Display

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify the image shows a 'Notice of Periods of Work' or 'Working Hours' chart.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Total Daily Hours'. If hours > 9 (excluding intervals) or if no rest interval is shown, flag as Potential Risk.

question_text: Is a day of rest provided in every period of seven days (Weekly Off), and is remuneration paid for such rest days?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Provide for a day of rest in every period of seven days which shall be allowed to all employees... and for the payment of remuneration in respect of such days of rest.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the Attendance Register / Muster Roll.
Step 2: Look for the 'W' or 'WO' (Weekly Off) marking.
Step 3: Ensure employees are not working continuously for more than 10 days without a break (or as per specific state rule, usually 6 days work + 1 rest).
Step 4: Ensure no deduction of wages is made for this mandatory rest day (for monthly rated employees).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the attendance register for the last month showing Weekly Offs markings.
capture_instructions.title: Weekly Rest Day Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify the document is an Attendance Register with daily presence markings.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Check for 'WO' or 'Rest Day' markers. If an employee shows 'Present' (P) for 10+ consecutive days without a 'WO', flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are employees paid for a full normal working day even if they worked less hours, provided the shortage was not due to their own unwillingness?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if short-duration work was assigned during the audit period.
legal_text: If an employee... works on any day on which he was employed for a period of less than the requisite number of hours... he shall... be entitled to receive wages in respect of work done on that day as if he had worked for a full normal working day.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the Wage Register for any 'Short Payment' or deductions for partial days.
Step 2: Cross-reference with the 'Loss of Pay' or 'Deduction' register.
Step 3: If deductions exist for partial attendance, verify if there is proof (e.g., employee application) that the employee left early voluntarily.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a sample wage slip where partial day deduction occurred, or a statement confirming no such deductions.
capture_instructions.title: Short Work Payment Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for Wage Slip or Register.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Identify if 'Days Payable' is a fraction (e.g., 25.5) or if deductions are labeled 'Short Hours'. If found, Manual Review is recommended to check for 'Unwillingness' proof.

question_text: Are wages paid exclusively in current coin, currency notes, by cheque, or by crediting the bank account/electronic mode?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: All wages shall be paid in current coin or currency notes or by cheque or by crediting the wages in the bank account of the employee or by the electronic mode.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request proof of wage disbursement for the audit period.
Step 2: Verify the mode of payment.
Step 3: If paid in cash, ensure valid currency is used (no kind payments unless specifically authorized).
Step 4: If by bank, verify transfer records match the wage register.

capture_instructions.document_name: Bank Transfer Advice / Cash Payment Register
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the bank transfer summary or the cash payment register signed by employees.
capture_instructions.title: Payment Mode Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a Bank Statement, Transfer Advice, or Signed Cash Register. Reject if irrelevant.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract the 'Mode of Payment' or infer from document type. If 'Kind' or 'Coupons' are detected as the sole wage payment, flag as Non-Compliant. Confirm presence of transaction IDs for electronic transfers.

question_text: Has the employer fixed a wage period (Daily, Weekly, Fortnightly, or Monthly) that does not exceed one month?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: The employer shall fix the wage period for employees either as daily or weekly or fortnightly or monthly subject to the condition that no wage period in respect of any employee shall be more than a month.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the Standing Orders or Employment Contracts.
Step 2: Verify the defined 'Wage Period'.
Step 3: Ensure the duration is not 'Quarterly' or 'Annually'.
Step 4: Confirm wages are calculated based on this fixed period.

capture_instructions.document_name: Notice of Wage Period / Employment Contract
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a photo of the notice board or a contract clause defining the wage period.
capture_instructions.title: Wage Period Definition

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for text indicating 'Wage Period', 'Salary Cycle', or 'Payment Frequency'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract the frequency (e.g., 'Monthly', 'Weekly'). If frequency > 1 month (e.g., 'Quarterly'), flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are wages paid before the statutory deadline (e.g., 7th of the next month for monthly rated employees)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: The employer shall pay... (i) daily basis, at the end of the shift; (ii) weekly basis, on the last working day of the week... (iv) monthly basis, before the expiry of the seventh day of the succeeding month.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify the wage period (e.g., Monthly).
Step 2: Locate the payment date on the Bank Statement or Transfer Advice.
Step 3: Compare this date against the 7th of the following month.
Step 4: For weekly/daily workers, check if paid immediately/end of week.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a bank statement page showing the salary debit date for the last month.
capture_instructions.title: Timeliness of Payment

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document shows transaction dates and amounts.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Transaction Date' and 'Wage Period Month'. If Wage Period is 'January' and Transaction Date is after 'February 7th', flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are wages for removed, dismissed, retrenched, or resigned employees paid within two working days?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if any employee separations occurred during the audit period.
legal_text: Where an employee has been (i) removed or dismissed... or (ii) retrenched or has resigned... the wages payable to him shall be paid within two working days of his removal, dismissal, retrenchment or... resignation.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the list of employees who left/resigned in the last 6 months.
Step 2: Select a sample (e.g., 2-3 employees).
Step 3: Check their 'Date of Exit' vs. 'Date of Full & Final Settlement' payment.
Step 4: Ensure the gap is <= 2 working days.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the F&F statement showing Date of Leaving and Date of Payment.
capture_instructions.title: Settlement Timeline Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if document is an 'F&F Statement' or 'Settlement Receipt'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Date of Leaving' (DoL) and 'Payment Date'. Calculate working days between them. If > 2 days, flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: In case of an employee's death, are undisbursed dues paid to the nominated person or deposited with the prescribed authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if any employee death occurred during the audit period.
legal_text: All amounts payable... shall... be paid to the person nominated by him... or where no such nomination has been made... be deposited with the such authority, as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Inquire if any employee death occurred.
Step 2: If yes, check the 'Nomination Form' of the deceased.
Step 3: Verify proof of payment to the nominee (Bank Transfer/Cheque Acknowledgement).
Step 4: If no nominee, verify deposit receipt with the Authority.

capture_instructions.document_name: Payment Receipt to Nominee / Authority Deposit Challan
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload proof of payment to the legal nominee or deposit receipt to the Authority.
capture_instructions.title: Deceased Employee Dues Settlement

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for 'Receipt', 'Cheque Copy', or 'Challan'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify if the payment is directed to a 'Nominee' or 'Authority'. If document indicates unpaid dues pending > 1 month post-death, flag for review.

question_text: Is the total amount of deductions (statutory + voluntary) in any wage period limited to 50% of the employee's total wages?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: The total amount of deductions which may be made under sub-section (2) in any wage period from the wages of an employee shall not exceed fifty per cent of such wages.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Wage Register for the audit month.
Step 2: Identify employees with high deductions (e.g., loans, advances, EMI).
Step 3: Compare 'Total Deductions' column against 'Gross Wages'.
Step 4: Ensure (Total Deductions / Gross Wages) * 100 <= 50.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a wage register page showing 'Gross Earnings' and 'Total Deductions' columns, highlighting any employee with deductions exceeding 50%.
capture_instructions.title: Deduction Limit Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a Wage Register containing financial columns. Reject if headers are missing.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Gross Wages' and 'Total Deductions' for 3 random rows. Calculate percentage: (Deductions / Gross) * 100. If result > 50 for any row, flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are fines imposed on employees only after giving them an opportunity to show cause, and are they limited to 3% of wages?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if any fines were imposed on employees during the audit period.
legal_text: No fine shall be imposed on any employee until such employee has been given an opportunity of showing cause... The total amount of fine... shall not exceed an amount equal to three per cent of the wages payable.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the 'Register of Fines'.
Step 2: If an entry exists, ask for the corresponding 'Show Cause Notice' issued to the employee and their reply.
Step 3: Verify the fine amount in the register does not exceed 3% of the monthly wage.

capture_instructions.document_name: Register of Fines & Show Cause Notice
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Register of Fines entry AND the Show Cause Notice copy for the same incident.
capture_instructions.title: Fine Procedure Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify the image contains a 'Register of Fines' or a legal 'Show Cause Notice'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: If a Register is uploaded, extract 'Wage' and 'Fine Amount'. Check if Fine <= 0.03 * Wage. If a Notice is uploaded, check for keywords 'Show Cause', 'Explanation', or 'Disciplinary'.

question_text: Are deductions for damage or loss strictly limited to the value of damage caused by the employee's neglect, and supported by a show-cause procedure?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if deductions for damage/loss were made.
legal_text: A deduction... for damage or loss shall not exceed the amount of the damage or loss caused to the employer by negligence or default of the employee... [and] shall not be made... until the employee has been given an opportunity of showing cause.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Review the 'Register of Deductions for Damage or Loss'.
Step 2: Verify that the deducted amount does not exceed the actual value of the item lost/damaged.
Step 3: Check for a recorded explanation or hearing proceeding (Show Cause) prior to deduction.
Step 4: Ensure the cause is explicitly 'Negligence' or 'Default', not accidental breakage.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the register showing the damage description, value, and deduction amount.
capture_instructions.title: Damage Deduction Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for a register with columns like 'Damage', 'Value', 'Deduction Amount'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Value of Damage' and 'Amount Deducted'. If Amount Deducted > Value of Damage, flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are recoveries of advances compliant, ensuring NO deduction is made for pre-employment travelling expenses?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if salary advances are given.
legal_text: Recovery of advance of money given to an employee before the employment began shall be made from the first payment of wages... but no recovery shall be made of such advances given for travelling expenses.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the 'Register of Advances' or Loan Book.
Step 2: Look for 'Travel Advance' or 'Relocation Advance' given to new joiners.
Step 3: Cross-check with the first month's wage slip.
Step 4: Ensure no deduction line item exists for 'Travel Expense Recovery' for pre-employment travel.

capture_instructions.document_name: Register of Advances / First Month Wage Slip
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Advance Register or the first wage slip of a new employee who received a joining advance.
capture_instructions.title: Advance Recovery Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for 'Advance' or 'Loan' recovery columns in a wage document.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan for deduction labels containing 'Travel', 'Ticket', or 'Journey' in the context of 'Recovery'. If found, flag for Manual Review to ensure it wasn't pre-employment travel.

question_text: Is a notice specifying the acts and omissions for which fines may be imposed exhibited prominently in the establishment?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: A notice specifying such acts and omissions shall be exhibited in such manner as may be prescribed, on the premises in which the employment is carried on.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Walk to the main Notice Board.
Step 2: Look for a list titled 'List of Acts and Omissions for which Fines may be Imposed'.
Step 3: Verify it is legible and in a language understood by the majority of workers.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the Notice Board displaying the list of finable acts.
capture_instructions.title: Fines Notice Display

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Verify the image shows a Notice Board with a list of rules.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Look for keywords 'Fines', 'Acts', 'Omissions', 'Misconduct'. If text is legible and contains these terms, mark as Compliant.

question_text: Are deductions for absence strictly proportional to the period of absence (except in cases of concerted illegal strikes)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if absence deductions (Loss of Pay) occurred.
legal_text: The amount of such deduction shall in no case bear to the wages payable... in a larger proportion than the period for which he was absent bears to the total period.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify an employee with 'Loss of Pay' (LOP) or 'Absent' days in the wage register.
Step 2: Calculate Proportional Wage: (Monthly Wage / Total Working Days) * Days Worked.
Step 3: Ensure the Paid Amount matches this calculation. (Deduction shouldn't differ from the actual absent time value).
Step 4: Check if '8-day deduction' penal rule was applied (only valid for strikes without notice).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a wage slip showing LOP/Absence deduction details.
capture_instructions.title: Absence Deduction Logic

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for 'Days Present', 'Days Absent', or 'LOP' fields.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Basic Wage', 'Days in Month', 'Days Paid'. Calculate expected pay. If Actual Pay < (Expected Pay - Small Rounding Error), flag for potential disproportionate deduction.

question_text: Has the employer paid the annual minimum bonus (8.33% of wages or â‚¹100, whichever is higher) to all employees who have worked for at least 30 days in the accounting year?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with 20 or more employees (or as notified).
legal_text: There shall be paid to every employee... who has put in at least thirty days work in an accounting year, an annual minimum bonus calculated at the rate of eight and one-third per cent of the wages earned... or one hundred rupees, whichever is higher.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Register of Bonus' (Form C equivalent) for the last completed accounting year.
Step 2: Identify employees who worked >30 days.
Step 3: Check the 'Total Annual Wages' and 'Bonus Paid' columns.
Step 4: Verify that Bonus Paid >= (Total Wages * 8.33%).

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the Bonus Register showing annual wage totals and bonus payment calculations.
capture_instructions.title: Minimum Bonus Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a Bonus Register containing columns for 'Annual Wages' and 'Bonus Payable'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Annual Wages' and 'Bonus Paid' for 3 random entries. Calculate (Annual Wages * 0.0833). If 'Bonus Paid' is less than the calculated amount, flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Was the bonus for the last accounting year paid within eight months from the close of that year?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments liable to pay bonus.
legal_text: All amounts payable to an employee by way of bonus... shall be paid... within a period of eight months from the close of the accounting year.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Determine the close of the financial year (usually March 31st).
Step 2: The statutory deadline is November 30th.
Step 3: Check the Bank Transfer Advice or Payment Receipt dates.
Step 4: Ensure the date is on or before November 30th.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the bank transfer advice or payment summary sheet showing the date of bonus credit.
capture_instructions.title: Bonus Payment Date Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document shows a payment date and reference to 'Bonus'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Payment Date'. If the date is later than November 30th of the relevant year, flag as Non-Compliant (unless an extension order is provided).

question_text: Is the bonus amount supported by a computation of 'Allocable Surplus' derived from 'Available Surplus'?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments liable to pay bonus.
legal_text: The bonus shall be paid out of the allocable surplus... of the available surplus and the available surplus shall be the amount calculated in accordance with section 33.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Computation of Allocable Surplus' sheet (Form A/B equivalent).
Step 2: Verify it starts with Gross Profit.
Step 3: Check deductions for Depreciation and Direct Taxes.
Step 4: Ensure 60% (for banking) or 67% (others) of Available Surplus is allocated for bonus.
Step 5: Verify the maximum bonus cap (20%) is respected if surplus is high.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the computation sheet showing Gross Profit, Deductions, and Allocable Surplus.
capture_instructions.title: Allocable Surplus Computation

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a financial computation sheet with fields like 'Gross Profit', 'Depreciation', 'Available Surplus'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify that 'Allocable Surplus' is calculated as 67% (or 60%) of 'Available Surplus'. Flag arithmetic errors.

question_text: If any employee was disqualified from receiving bonus, is the disqualification based on dismissal for fraud, violent behavior, theft, or sexual harassment?
applicability_criteria: Applicable only if employees were disqualified from bonus.
legal_text: An employee shall be disqualified from receiving bonus under this Code, if he is dismissed from service for (a) fraud; or (b) riotous or violent behaviour... or (c) theft, misappropriation or sabotage... or (d) conviction for sexual harassment.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask if any eligible employee was denied bonus.
Step 2: If yes, request the 'Dismissal Order' or 'Termination Letter'.
Step 3: Verify the reason for dismissal matches the statutory disqualification grounds (Fraud, Theft, Violence, Sexual Harassment).
Step 4: Ensure the dismissal process (inquiry) was completed.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the dismissal letter stating the specific reason for disqualification from bonus.
capture_instructions.title: Disqualification Validation

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a 'Dismissal Order' or 'Termination Letter'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan text for keywords: 'Fraud', 'Theft', 'Violent', 'Sexual Harassment', 'Misappropriation'. If these grounds are missing but bonus is denied, flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are records maintained for the 'Set On' and 'Set Off' of allocable surplus for the relevant accounting years (up to 4 years)?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments liable to pay bonus.
legal_text: Excess shall... be carried forward for being set on in the succeeding accounting year... deficiency... shall be carried forward for being set off... up to and inclusive of the fourth accounting year.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the 'Set On and Set Off' statement (Form B equivalent).
Step 2: Check the history of the last 4 years.
Step 3: Verify if current year's payment utilized any previous 'Set On' or carried forward a new 'Set Off'.
Step 4: Ensure the sequence is maintained correctly.

capture_instructions.document_name: Set On and Set Off Statement (Form B)
capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the statement showing the history of allocable surplus for the last 4 years.
capture_instructions.title: Set On/Set Off History

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for a table with columns like 'Accounting Year', 'Amount Available', 'Set On', 'Set Off'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify if the 'Carried Forward' amount from Year X matches the 'Brought Forward' amount in Year X+1. Flag inconsistencies.

question_text: For employees who worked less than the total working days in the year, was the minimum bonus reduced proportionately?
applicability_criteria: Applicable if there are employees who worked partial years (e.g., new joiners).
legal_text: Where an employee has not worked for all the working days in an accounting year, the minimum bonus... shall be proportionately reduced.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify an employee who joined mid-year or had significant authorized unpaid leave.
Step 2: Check their total wages earned vs. theoretical full-year wages.
Step 3: Verify the bonus paid is proportionate to the days worked (if paying minimum bonus).
Step 4: Note: If paying % of wages (e.g. 10%), the calculation on actual earned wages automatically adjusts this.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the bonus calculation row for an employee who worked for a partial year.
capture_instructions.title: Proportionate Reduction Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for Bonus Register row.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Days Worked' and 'Bonus Paid'. If 'Days Worked' < Total Working Days, ensure Bonus is not the full flat rate (e.g. 7000) but a proportion, or exactly 8.33% of 'Earned Wages'.

question_text: Is the establishment maintaining a Register of Wages containing details of persons employed, muster roll, and wages paid?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments (except agriculture/domestic with <=5 employees).
legal_text: Every employer... shall maintain a register containing the details with regard to persons employed, muster roll, wages and such other details in such manner as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the combined 'Register of Wages, Muster Roll and Employees' (often Form I or Form IV depending on state rules).
Step 2: Ensure it covers all employees, including contract labor if applicable.
Step 3: Verify columns for 'Daily Attendance', 'Overtime', 'Gross Wages', 'Deductions', and 'Net Pay' are filled.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a clear image of the register page for the last complete wage period.
capture_instructions.title: Register Maintenance Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a Register with tabular employee data. Reject if blank or illegible.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Check for the presence of key columns: 'Name', 'Designation', 'Attendance/Days Worked', 'Gross Wages', 'Deductions', 'Net Payable'. If multiple key columns are missing, flag as Non-Compliant.

question_text: Are wage slips issued to all employees in the prescribed form at least a day prior to the disbursement of wages?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Every employer shall issue wage slips to the employees in such form and manner as may be prescribed.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Ask for a random sample of 3 issued wage slips from the last month.
Step 2: Check if they contain: Name, UAN/ID, Wage Period, Gross Wages (broken down), Deductions, and Net Pay.
Step 3: Confirm with employees (if possible) that they received this before payment.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a copy of a standard wage slip issued to an employee.
capture_instructions.title: Wage Slip Format Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a 'Pay Slip' or 'Wage Slip'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Extract 'Wage Period', 'Basic Wage', 'Deductions', and 'Net Pay'. Ensure the slip is not a generic calculator screenshot but a formal document with the Establishment Name.

question_text: Is the Abstract of the Code on Wages, 2019 displayed at a prominent place in the establishment?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Every employer shall display a notice on the notice board... containing the abstract of this Code.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Go to the main entrance or time-office notice board.
Step 2: Look for a poster titled 'Abstract of the Code on Wages'.
Step 3: Ensure it is in English and the local language understood by the majority of workers.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the 'Abstract of the Act' displayed on the notice board.
capture_instructions.title: Abstract Display

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the image shows a 'Notice Board' or 'Poster'.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Look for text 'Abstract', 'Code on Wages', 'Rights', 'Duties'. If text is clearly visible, mark as Compliant.

question_text: Does the notice board display category-wise wage rates, wage period, and the date/time of payment?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Display a notice... containing... category-wise wage rates of employees, wage period, day or date and time of payment of wages.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Locate the specific 'Notice of Wages' or 'Payment Details' on the board.
Step 2: Verify it lists categories (e.g., Skilled/Unskilled) and their corresponding rates.
Step 3: Check if the 'Date of Payment' (e.g., '7th of every month') is clearly stated.

capture_instructions.document_name: Notice of Wage Rates & Pay Day
capture_instructions.instruction: Capture the specific notice showing wage rates and payment schedules.
capture_instructions.title: Wage Details Notice

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for a tabular notice or list.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan for keywords 'Unskilled', 'Skilled', 'Minimum Wage', 'Date of Payment'. If these elements exist, mark as Compliant.

question_text: Are the name and address of the Inspector-cum-Facilitator having jurisdiction displayed on the notice board?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
legal_text: Display a notice... containing... the name and address of the Inspector-cum-Facilitator having jurisdiction.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Check the notice board for 'Inspector Details'.
Step 2: Verify it contains a Name (or Designation), Office Address, and Contact Number/Email.
Step 3: Ensure the information is current and not faded/torn.

capture_instructions.instruction: Take a photo of the section of the notice board displaying the Inspector's contact details.
capture_instructions.title: Inspector Details Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for contact details on a notice.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Look for keywords 'Inspector', 'Facilitator', 'Address', 'Labor Office'. If an address block is detected, mark as Compliant.

question_text: Are the establishment's financial statements (Balance Sheet and Profit & Loss Account) duly audited by a qualified auditor to support Bonus calculations?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all Corporations and Companies.
legal_text: The balance sheet and the profit and loss account of an employer, being a corporation or a company... duly audited by the Comptroller and Auditor General of India or by auditors duly qualified... may presume the statements... to be accurate.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Request the Audited Balance Sheet and P&L Account for the last accounting year.
Step 2: Check for the Auditor's Stamp and Signature (Chartered Accountant).
Step 3: Verify the figures match the 'Gross Profit' used in Bonus computations.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the cover page and signature page of the Audited Balance Sheet/P&L.
capture_instructions.title: Audited Accounts Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check if the document is a Balance Sheet or Profit & Loss Account. Reject if it looks like a simple spreadsheet without auditor markings.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Check for 'Auditor Report', 'Chartered Accountant' stamp, or 'UDIN'. Verify the financial year matches the audit period.

question_text: If the employer is NOT a corporation or company, are accounts maintained and audited (if required) to justify bonus liability?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to partnerships, proprietorships, or HUFs.
legal_text: Where... bonus payable... between an employer, not being a corporation or a company... authority... may, by order, direct the employer to get his accounts audited.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Confirm the entity type (Proprietorship/Partnership).
Step 2: Check if accounts are audited under Income Tax Act or specific Labour Authority order.
Step 3: If not audited, review the internal P&L statement signed by the owner.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload the P&L statement signed by the Proprietor/Partner.
capture_instructions.title: Non-Corporate Accounts Check

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for a financial statement signed by an individual owner/partner.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Verify presence of 'Profit' or 'Loss' figures. Check for signatures.

question_text: Does the company/firm acting as the proprietor of the establishment accept ultimate responsibility for payment of dues if the immediate employer fails to pay?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments, especially those using intermediaries/contractors.
legal_text: Provided that where such employer fails to make such payment... then, the company or firm or association or any other person who is the proprietor of the establishment... shall be responsible for such payment.

inspection_steps: Step 1: Identify if contractors are used.
Step 2: Request proof that the Principal Employer monitors contractor wage payments.
Step 3: Check for any 'Undertaking' or clause in vendor contracts regarding wage liability.
Step 4: Verify if the company has directly settled dues for any contractor failures.

capture_instructions.instruction: Upload a document showing the Principal Employer's verification of contractor payments or a liability undertaking.
capture_instructions.title: Proprietor Liability Verification

ai_logic.gatekeeper_check: Prompt: Check for a contract, compliance report, or indemnity bond.
ai_logic.verification_logic: Prompt: Scan for keywords 'Principal Employer', 'Liability', 'Wage Payment', 'Reimbursement'. If the document confirms the Principal Employer checks payments, mark as Compliant.
